hints.label: def-coupled-cloning-expectation
hints.title: Coupled Cloning Expectation
hints.content:
6329: :label: def-coupled-cloning-expectation
6330: 
6331: Consider two swarms $(S_1, S_2)$ in the coupled state space (see {prf:ref}`def-coupled-state-space`). Let $(S'_1, S'_2)$ be the output swarms after applying $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ to each independently, using **synchronous coupling** of all randomness:
6332: 
6333: - Same PRNG seeds for companion selection
6334: - Same pairing algorithm random choices
6335: - Same threshold samples $T_i$ for each walker index $i$
6336: - Same Gaussian jitters $\zeta_i^x$ for position updates (when both walkers clone)
6337: - Same rotation operators $R_i$ for velocity collisions (when both walkers participate in collisions)
6338: 
6339: For any function $f: \Sigma_N \times \Sigma_N \to \mathbb{R}$, the **coupled cloning expectation** is:
6340: 
6341: $$
6342: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[f(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] := \mathbb{E}[f(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2, \text{coupling}]
hints.raw_directive:
6326: To analyze the drift of the Lyapunov function components, we work with two copies of the swarm evolving under synchronous coupling.

6328: :::{prf:definition} Coupled Cloning Expectation
6329: :label: def-coupled-cloning-expectation
6330: 
6331: Consider two swarms $(S_1, S_2)$ in the coupled state space (see {prf:ref}`def-coupled-state-space`). Let $(S'_1, S'_2)$ be the output swarms after applying $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ to each independently, using **synchronous coupling** of all randomness:
6332: 
6333: - Same PRNG seeds for companion selection
6334: - Same pairing algorithm random choices
6335: - Same threshold samples $T_i$ for each walker index $i$
6336: - Same Gaussian jitters $\zeta_i^x$ for position updates (when both walkers clone)
6337: - Same rotation operators $R_i$ for velocity collisions (when both walkers participate in collisions)
6338: 
6339: For any function $f: \Sigma_N \times \Sigma_N \to \mathbb{R}$, the **coupled cloning expectation** is:
6340: 
6341: $$
6342: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[f(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] := \mathbb{E}[f(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2, \text{coupling}]
6343: $$

hints.label: rem-coupling-benefits
hints.title: Synchronous Coupling Benefits
hints.content:
6348: :label: rem-coupling-benefits
6349: 
6350: The synchronous coupling ensures that:
6351: 
6352: 1. **Common randomness cancels:** When both swarms have walker $i$ in similar states and both make the same cloning decision, much of the random perturbation is shared, reducing divergence.
6353: 
6354: 2. **Worst-case expansion is bounded:** Even when the swarms make different decisions (e.g., walker $i$ clones in swarm 1 but persists in swarm 2), the expansion is controlled by the maximum displacement $D_{\text{valid}}$.
